summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 8873, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Columbia Street, in the City of Seattle, from Third Avenue to the alley between Eighth Avenue and Ninth Avenue, by constructing concrete sidewalks, wood curbs and gutters, catch basins and bulkheads; Resolution No. 334, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington, entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
